Taxon name.Name: Ogataea polymorpha
Taxon name.Synonymy:
Current name: Ogataea polymorpha (Morais & M.H. Maia) Y. Yamada, K. Maeda & Mikata 1994 MB#362660 
Basionym: Hansenula polymorpha Morais & M.H. Maia 1959 MB#331666 
Taxonomic synonyms: 
   - Hansenula angusta Wickerham 1951 MB#298106 
   - Torulopsis methanothermo Urakami 1975 MB#456606 
   - Candida thermophila K.S. Shin, Y.K. Shin, J.H. Yoon & Y.H. Park 2001 MB#484856

Other culture collection numbers: ATCC 34438; CBS 4732; CCRC 20467; DSM 70277; IFO 1476; JCM 3621; MUCL 27761; NCYC 1457; NRRL Y-5445
Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: no known restrictions under the Nagoya protocol
History: IHEM, 1992 < MUCL, 1980 < OSM < CBS < A.C. Batista <
Applications: catalase activity following growth on methanol (Arch. Mikrobiol. 105: 261-267, 1975); produces: alcohol oxidase (J. Microbiol. Methods 2: 15-25,1984; J. Bacteriol. 174: 5391-5399, 1992), alcohol dehydrogenase (Yeast 4: 117-126 and 143-148, 1988; Acta Biotechnol. 11: 373-378, 1991), dihydroxyacetone reductase and acetone reductase (ibid., 4: 117-126, 1988), copper-containing amine oxidase (J. Biol. Chem. 267: 7979-7982, 1992) and SCP from xylose (Process Biochem. Int. 25: 136-140, 1990)
